hed: 20 Awesomely Rando  Words Oxford Added to the Dictionary This Year
dek: Just in time for your first English paper of the semester.

items.caption: Recently, the [Oxford Dictionaries](http://blog.oxforddictionaries.com/2015/08/new-words-update-manspreading-mic-drop) (the OED’s younger, hipper sister) announced the addition of a whole bunch of new words that you should definitely try to work into your English essays this school year. The dictionary focuses on modern language, so each year their new entries are pulled from things like pop culture, tech, and internet slang. And lest you think that these words are just trendy, there’s always a possibility that years and years (and years) from now, they’ll make their way into the real deal Oxford English dictionary. After all, William Shakespeare made up quite a few words in his day that have become mainstays of the English language. We’ve rounded up our favorites among the [new additions](http://time.com/4010748/oxford-dictionary-update-2015/) and just to be super helpful, we’ve used each and every one of them in a sentence (you know, so it’s even easier to slip them into your creative writing assignment).
“No homework tonight? Awesomesauce.”
“I’d like a burrito bowl to go, white rice, no beans, and barbacoa, please.”
“The teacher called on me and I knew the answer, but I had a brain fart and completely spaced.”
“Hey bruh, you watching the Patriots game later?
"Did you mean to call me? I have a voicemail from you, but I kind of assumed it was a butt-dial."
"My mom won't let me adopt a kitten, but she said she'd pay for as many trips to the cat cafe as I want."
“The backlash to the YouTube video made it clear that it’s never okay to fat-shame anyone, even if it’s supposedly ‘satire.’”
"She loves that little chihuahua so much, it's like her fur baby."
“You haven’t done the history reading? Do it at lunch, it’s totally glanceable.”
“I always keep a snack in my bag so I don’t get hangry and lash out.”
“I forgot my keys, so I had to MacGyver a lock-pick from the stray bobby pins in my gym bag.”
“I really loved *Paper Towns* but I could never decide if Margo was destroying the manic pixie dream girl trope or simply another, more self-aware version of it.”
“I had all my bags on the train and there was totally a seat open, but the two guys on either side were manspreading so wide that I couldn’t squeeze in.”
"She asked me to recite the quadratic formula and I was like, 'X is equal to negative B plus or minus the square root of B squared minus 4AC, all over 2A *mic drop*.'"
“You might think it’s a neutral statement to say that someone of another race ‘talks white,’ but really it’s a microaggression that implies that people of other races are a stereotypical monolith.”

“I’m running 10-12 minutes late.”  
“Mkay.” *fumes silently*
"Did you see the South Korean team take on the U.S. team in StarCraft? Total pwnage. I mean, it's basically a professional sport over there."
"Our guild was trying to beat this boss over and over again, and by the fifth time we died I was so ready to just rage-quit and get some fro-yo instead."
“I was going to wait outside for you but this rando kept staring at me, so I walked around the block instead.”
“Did you see how swole Nick Jonas got for his TV show? He is seriously jacked.”

socialTitle: 20 Awesomely Rando  Words Oxford Added to the Dictionary This Year
socialDescription: Just in time for your first English paper of the semester.
